recap_documents.description: ORDER ON MOTION TO STRIKE CLASS ALLEGATION AND MOTIONS TO DISMISS (Dkt.  21 ,  22 ,  78 ).  The Court finds and ORDERS: Defendants' Motion to Strike Class Allegations (Dkt.  21 ) is GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART; Defendants' Motion to  Dismiss (Dkt.  22 ) is GRANTED IN PART AND DENIED IN PART;  Defendants' Renewed Motion to Dismiss for Lack of Standing (Dkt.  78 ) is GRANTED; Plaintiffs' Motion to Seal (Dkt.  93 ) is GRANTED; Plaintiffs' Claims 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9 , 10, 11, 12, 13, and 14 of the Second Amended Complaint (Dkt.  19 ) are DISMISSED. Plaintiffs are not permitted leave to amend the complaint. As there is only one remaining state law claim (Claim 6), Plaintiffs are ORDERED to show cause no later than 3/25/2024 why this matter should not be dismissed for lack of subject matter jurisdiction.    Signed  by U.S. District Judge David G Estudillo.(AMD)

recap_documents.description: ORDER AND ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE TO PLAINTIFF denying 221  Plaintiff's Motion for Summary Judgment Under Rule 56.  Within twenty-one (21) days from the date of this Order, Plaintiff shall SHOW CAUSE in writing why summary judgment should not  be entered in favor of Defendants based on an inability to establish as a matter of law that Defendants are directly or vicariously liable for the calls in question, and/or that Defendant Marcos I. Taveras can be held individually liable for the TCPA violations that remain at issue.  Plaintiff's response shall not exceed twenty (20) pages, and is limited to legal argument only.  Signed by Magistrate Judge Leslie Hoffman Price on 3/28/2023. (MKH)
